item.title: XPS 13 9380 (2019) Review
item.description: As a Linux user, using a recent model of MacBook Pro was nothing but a misadventure, especially given that the laptop I had prior to that was Dell XPS 13 9350, which had a Developer Edition with Linux pre-loaded, which meant it could run Linux without too much trouble. The problems with MacBook Pro were not limited to the difficulties in using Linux or the serious locking-down of macOS, but also the quality control, and their Idiot Genius Bar’s treating me like an idiot with a wallet that leaks money.
